trans-unit.source: Monitor your app's health and usage with Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Monitor your app's health and usage with Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Get started with Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Get started with Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Analyze usage, availability and performance of your on-premises or Microsoft Azure applications.
trans-unit.target: Analyze usage, availability and performance of your on-premises or Microsoft Azure applications.

trans-unit.source: Monitor performance in web applications
trans-unit.target: Monitor performance in web applications

trans-unit.source: Application Insights is in preview.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights is in preview.

trans-unit.source: Make sure your application is performing well, and find out quickly about any failures.
trans-unit.target: Make sure your application is performing well, and find out quickly about any failures.

trans-unit.source: [Application Insights][start] will tell you about any performance issues and exceptions, and help you find and diagnose the root causes.
trans-unit.target: [Application Insights][start] will tell you about any performance issues and exceptions, and help you find and diagnose the root causes.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights can monitor ASP.NET web applications and WCF services, hosted on-premise or on virtual machines, as well as Microsoft Azure websites.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights can monitor ASP.NET web applications and WCF services, hosted on-premise or on virtual machines, as well as Microsoft Azure websites.

trans-unit.source: Set up performance monitoring
trans-unit.target: Set up performance monitoring

trans-unit.source: If you haven't yet added Application Insights to your project (that is, if it doesn't have ApplicationInsights.config), choose one of these ways to get started:
trans-unit.target: If you haven't yet added Application Insights to your project (that is, if it doesn't have ApplicationInsights.config), choose one of these ways to get started:

trans-unit.source: [Add Application Insights to your project in Visual Studio][greenbrown] - Recommended.
trans-unit.target: [Add Application Insights to your project in Visual Studio][greenbrown] - Recommended.

trans-unit.source: As well as passive performance monitoring, you can insert diagnostic logging and track usage.
trans-unit.target: As well as passive performance monitoring, you can insert diagnostic logging and track usage.

trans-unit.source: [Monitor performance of a live website now][redfield] - This way, you don't need to update the application project or redeploy the website.
trans-unit.target: [Monitor performance of a live website now][redfield] - This way, you don't need to update the application project or redeploy the website.

trans-unit.source: [For a Microsoft Azure website](../insights-how-to-customize-monitoring.md) you can already see metrics on the website's Monitoring lens.
trans-unit.target: [For a Microsoft Azure website](../insights-how-to-customize-monitoring.md) you can already see metrics on the website's Monitoring lens.

trans-unit.source: Using either of these methods, you'll quickly see data on the overview blade in Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Using either of these methods, you'll quickly see data on the overview blade in Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Exploring metrics
trans-unit.target: Exploring metrics

trans-unit.source: Click any to see more detail, and to see results for a longer period.
trans-unit.target: Click any to see more detail, and to see results for a longer period.

trans-unit.source: For example, click the Requests tile and then select a time range:
trans-unit.target: For example, click the Requests tile and then select a time range:

trans-unit.source: Click through to more data and select a time range
trans-unit.target: Click through to more data and select a time range

trans-unit.source: Click a chart to choose which metrics it displays, or add a new chart and select its metrics:
trans-unit.target: Click a chart to choose which metrics it displays, or add a new chart and select its metrics:

trans-unit.source: Click a graph to choose metrics
trans-unit.target: Click a graph to choose metrics

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] **Uncheck all the metrics** to see the full selection that is available.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] **Uncheck all the metrics** to see the full selection that is available.

trans-unit.source: The metrics fall into groups; when any member of a group is selected, only the other members of that group appear.
trans-unit.target: The metrics fall into groups; when any member of a group is selected, only the other members of that group appear.

trans-unit.source: What does it all mean?
trans-unit.target: What does it all mean?

trans-unit.source: Performance tiles and reports
trans-unit.target: Performance tiles and reports

trans-unit.source: There's a variety of performance metrics you can get.
trans-unit.target: There's a variety of performance metrics you can get.

trans-unit.source: Let's start with those that appear by default on the application blade.
trans-unit.target: Let's start with those that appear by default on the application blade.

trans-unit.source: Requests
trans-unit.target: Requests

trans-unit.source: The number of HTTP requests received in a specified period.
trans-unit.target: The number of HTTP requests received in a specified period.

trans-unit.source: Compare this with the results on other reports to see how your app behaves as the load varies.
trans-unit.target: Compare this with the results on other reports to see how your app behaves as the load varies.

trans-unit.source: HTTP requests include all GET or POST requests for pages, data and images.
trans-unit.target: HTTP requests include all GET or POST requests for pages, data and images.

trans-unit.source: Click on the tile to get counts for specific URLs.
trans-unit.target: Click on the tile to get counts for specific URLs.

trans-unit.source: Average response time
trans-unit.target: Average response time

trans-unit.source: Measures the time between a web request entering your application and the response being returned.
trans-unit.target: Measures the time between a web request entering your application and the response being returned.

trans-unit.source: The points show a moving average.
trans-unit.target: The points show a moving average.

trans-unit.source: If there are a lot of requests, there might be some that deviate from the average without an obvious peak or dip in the graph.
trans-unit.target: If there are a lot of requests, there might be some that deviate from the average without an obvious peak or dip in the graph.

trans-unit.source: Look for unusual peaks.
trans-unit.target: Look for unusual peaks.

trans-unit.source: In general, expect response time to rise with a rise in requests.
trans-unit.target: In general, expect response time to rise with a rise in requests.

trans-unit.source: If the rise is disproportionate, your app might be hitting a resource limit such as CPU or the capacity of a service it uses.
trans-unit.target: If the rise is disproportionate, your app might be hitting a resource limit such as CPU or the capacity of a service it uses.

trans-unit.source: Click on the tile to get times for specific URLs.
trans-unit.target: Click on the tile to get times for specific URLs.

trans-unit.source: Slowest requests
trans-unit.target: Slowest requests

trans-unit.source: Shows which requests might need performance tuning.
trans-unit.target: Shows which requests might need performance tuning.

trans-unit.source: Failed requests
trans-unit.target: Failed requests

trans-unit.source: A count of requests that threw uncaught exceptions.
trans-unit.target: A count of requests that threw uncaught exceptions.

trans-unit.source: Click the tile to see the details of specific failures, and select an individual request to see its detail.
trans-unit.target: Click the tile to see the details of specific failures, and select an individual request to see its detail.

trans-unit.source: Only a representative sample of failures is retained for individual inspection.
trans-unit.target: Only a representative sample of failures is retained for individual inspection.

trans-unit.source: Other metrics
trans-unit.target: Other metrics

trans-unit.source: To see what other metrics you can display, click a graph, and then deselect all the metrics to see the full available set.
trans-unit.target: To see what other metrics you can display, click a graph, and then deselect all the metrics to see the full available set.

trans-unit.source: Click (i) to see each metric's definition.
trans-unit.target: Click (i) to see each metric's definition.

trans-unit.source: Deselect all metrics to see the whole set
trans-unit.target: Deselect all metrics to see the whole set

trans-unit.source: Selecting any metric will disable the others that can't appear on the same chart.
trans-unit.target: Selecting any metric will disable the others that can't appear on the same chart.

trans-unit.source: System performance counters
trans-unit.target: System performance counters

trans-unit.source: Some of the metrics you can choose from are [performance counters](http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/8590/An-Introduction-To-Performance-Counters).
trans-unit.target: Some of the metrics you can choose from are [performance counters](http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/8590/An-Introduction-To-Performance-Counters).

trans-unit.source: Windows provides a wide variety of them, and you can also define your own.
trans-unit.target: Windows provides a wide variety of them, and you can also define your own.

trans-unit.source: This example shows performance counters that are available by default.
trans-unit.target: This example shows performance counters that are available by default.

trans-unit.source: We have [added a separate chart](app-insights-metrics-explorer.md#editing-charts-and-grids) for each counter, and named the chart by [saving it as a favorite](app-insights-metrics-explorer.md#editing-charts-and-grids):
trans-unit.target: We have [added a separate chart](app-insights-metrics-explorer.md#editing-charts-and-grids) for each counter, and named the chart by [saving it as a favorite](app-insights-metrics-explorer.md#editing-charts-and-grids):

trans-unit.source: If the counters you want aren't in the properties list, you can add them to the set that the SDK collects.
trans-unit.target: If the counters you want aren't in the properties list, you can add them to the set that the SDK collects.

trans-unit.source: Open ApplicationInsights.config and edit the performance collector directive:
trans-unit.target: Open ApplicationInsights.config and edit the performance collector directive:

trans-unit.source: The format is `\Category(instance)\Counter"` or for categories that don't have instances, just `\Category\Counter`.
trans-unit.target: The format is `\Category(instance)\Counter"` or for categories that don't have instances, just `\Category\Counter`.

trans-unit.source: To discover what counters are available in your system, read [this introduction](http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/8590/An-Introduction-To-Performance-Counters).
trans-unit.target: To discover what counters are available in your system, read [this introduction](http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/8590/An-Introduction-To-Performance-Counters).

trans-unit.source: `ReportAs` is required for counter names that contain characters other than these: letters, round brackets, forward slahes, hyphens, underscores, spaces and dots.
trans-unit.target: `ReportAs` is required for counter names that contain characters other than these: letters, round brackets, forward slahes, hyphens, underscores, spaces and dots.

trans-unit.source: If you specify an instance, it will be collected as a property "CounterInstanceName" of the reported metric.
trans-unit.target: If you specify an instance, it will be collected as a property "CounterInstanceName" of the reported metric.

trans-unit.source: If you prefer, you can write code to have the same effect:
trans-unit.target: If you prefer, you can write code to have the same effect:

trans-unit.source: Set alerts
trans-unit.target: Set alerts

trans-unit.source: To be notified by email of unusual values of any metric, add an alert.
trans-unit.target: To be notified by email of unusual values of any metric, add an alert.

trans-unit.source: You can choose either to send the email to the account administrators, or to specific email addresses.
trans-unit.target: You can choose either to send the email to the account administrators, or to specific email addresses.

trans-unit.source: Set the resource before the other properties.
trans-unit.target: Set the resource before the other properties.

trans-unit.source: Don't choose the webtest resources if you want to set alerts on performance or usage metrics.
trans-unit.target: Don't choose the webtest resources if you want to set alerts on performance or usage metrics.

trans-unit.source: Be careful to note the units in which you're asked to enter the threshold value.
trans-unit.target: Be careful to note the units in which you're asked to enter the threshold value.

trans-unit.source: I don't see the Add Alert button.
trans-unit.target: I don't see the Add Alert button.

trans-unit.source: - Is this a group account to which you have read-only access?
trans-unit.target: - Is this a group account to which you have read-only access?

trans-unit.source: Check with the account administrator.
trans-unit.target: Check with the account administrator.

trans-unit.source: Diagnosing issues
trans-unit.target: Diagnosing issues

trans-unit.source: Here are a few tips for finding and diagnosing performance issues:
trans-unit.target: Here are a few tips for finding and diagnosing performance issues:

trans-unit.source: Set up [web tests][availability] to be alerted if your web site goes down or responds incorrectly or slowly.
trans-unit.target: Set up [web tests][availability] to be alerted if your web site goes down or responds incorrectly or slowly.

trans-unit.source: Compare the Request count with other metrics to see if failures or slow response are related to load.
trans-unit.target: Compare the Request count with other metrics to see if failures or slow response are related to load.

trans-unit.source: [Insert and search trace statements][diagnostic] in your code to help pinpoint problems.
trans-unit.target: [Insert and search trace statements][diagnostic] in your code to help pinpoint problems.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: [Web tests][availability] - Have web requests sent to your application at regular intervals from around the world.
trans-unit.target: [Web tests][availability] - Have web requests sent to your application at regular intervals from around the world.

trans-unit.source: [Capture and search diagnostic traces][diagnostic] - Insert trace calls and sift through the results to pinpoint issues.
trans-unit.target: [Capture and search diagnostic traces][diagnostic] - Insert trace calls and sift through the results to pinpoint issues.

trans-unit.source: [Usage tracking][usage] - Find out how people use your application.
trans-unit.target: [Usage tracking][usage] - Find out how people use your application.

trans-unit.source: [Troubleshooting][qna] - and Q & A
trans-unit.target: [Troubleshooting][qna] - and Q & A

trans-unit.source: Video
trans-unit.target: Video

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
